Reviews.Title: Bushnell X8 Works Great Day and Night
Reviews.Author: mdrewhall
Reviews.Content: I've had the Bushnell X-8 trail camera in the field for a month and I couldn't be more pleased with the results. It's on a trailhead with approximately 15 feet of space before a corn field begins. I knew the deer were using this trail because of the amount of corn which was eaten off the stalks and their tracks. I just couldn't wait to get this camera on the tree and see what bucks might be visiting on opening morning of bow season.When I initially set the camera up I placed it on Field Scan mode to automatically take a 3-photo-burst every two minutes for the last hour and half of day light. During the time it was on Field Scan mode for more than 3 weeks the Bushnell X-8 took more than 2,000 photos and with most of them being on Field Scan mode during the day time. During the first week of testing I got almost no PIR (Passive Infrared) photos. I thought maybe there were no deer at all using the area, but then I had a few deer caught on the Field Scan mode, so that couldn't have been the case.After re-examining the instruction manual, I found the PIR sensor is adjustable. The manual says:When setting up the camera to capture images of wildlife on hot summer days, it can be more difficult for the sensor to detect the temperature difference between animals and their surroundings. Setting the sensitivity switch to "H" can help, since it makes the PIR more sensitive to small differences in temperature. The opposite is also true-setting the switch to "L" can help prevent false or too frequent triggers during the low ambient temperatures of winter. And "M" (medium) is a good setting for moderate fall and spring temperatures.Following the PIR settings readjustments and putting it back on the tree, the camera captured numerous photos of deer and other wildlife as soon as they entered the detection zone. It was great to see that a simple switch adjustment would make all the difference in the world. The best part about it was during the testing I was only using 4 alkaline AA batteries and the camera will accept up to 8 lithium AA for maximum battery life. After a month in the field taking more than 2,000 photos and about 25 videos as well, the battery bar had not moved from full.After seeing the Field Scan mode and PIR photo mode worked well at both day and night, it was time to test out the video mode. I wasn't even aware it would take videos at night, until I pulled the card the first time; but it really does a great job. You can tell so much more about the deer when they are moving in the video, than in a still photo. It could definitely make the difference in distinguishing a shooter buck from a non-shooter even with the excellent image quality. Seeing how different deer move and react will allow hunters to more accurately identify deer while in the stand.If you are having second thoughts about which trail camera to buy, you can't go wrong with this one. It's tiny, takes great photos and videos, and is simple to set up. Add in the fact that it has a 9-month battery life on eight lithium AA batteries taking up to 30 photos a day, and I'm sold. To see the instruction manual on the Bushnell X-8 trail camera see Bushnell's web site.Sample videos:[...]

Reviews.Title: X-8 as Security
Reviews.Author: Lawrence M Crutcher
Reviews.Content: First the good. The size, price, storage capacity, and image quality add up to good value. The date and time display is very clear. Then the less-than-perfect. Although an American company and product, the manual appears to have been prepared by an ESL writer. The controls and display remind one of an early cell phone, which, combined with the unclear manual, make set-up a small challenge. Sadly, the controls on my unit froze up upon the third adjustment, and I had to return it as unusable. There is a feature, possibly designed to help farmers watch their corn grow, of taking one picture every-so-many minutes, perhaps also to save on storage. On my unit it would not turn off. My goal was to photo intruders on property, similar to the original purpose of photoing wildlife. But the time-sequence lock, permitting one picture only every-so-many-minutes, meant that the subject could slip in and out of range without being photo'd. The nighttime images were okay, distinguishable, but nowhere near as good as the excellent daytime images.

Reviews.Title: Great  value, good pics
Reviews.Author: Newbie DIYer "Double D"
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera to determine from which direction animals are coming in to your food plot or bait. You can set it up to take a photo every minute for hours close to feeding times. I have had mine set up for three months on the same batteries, a big plus. It's nice and small and easily attached with the supplied strap. An excellent hunting aid and would recommend this to all deer hunters especially. Would advise to get a 32gb card. It will save thousands of pics. Only thing not liked is the color. I don't know why most manufacturers make these things out of shiny green plastic. They need to be a matte gray color to blend in with tree bark and to discourage thieves.

Reviews.Title: Very good for the price!
Reviews.Author: Zigs
Reviews.Content: I bought this just to put by our 2 ponds and it works great. It is smaller than the stealth cams and takes great pictures durning the day and night. The best part is it only needs 4 AA batteries but you can put up to 8 in it.Update- I have had this trail camera for over a year now and it has taken thousands of photos and it still works great.

Reviews.Title: Only a 2 megapixel sensor
Reviews.Author: B. Hayes "BHP"
Reviews.Content: The name "x-8" gives an initial impression this is an 8 megapixel camera, however reading the product description it states it is a 6 megapixel camera. This is not the case... I bought this to take photos of wildlife in my backyard. When viewing the images I noticed that the 6 megapixel setting seemed to be "grainy" and not as clear as my 3.2 megapixel cell phone. After reading the Instruction Manual that came with the unit it states that the camera sensor is only a 2 megapixel sensor. The 4 and 6 megapixel images are created via interpolation which is a "smoke and mirrors" technique for the software to generate a higher resolution image. However it is not a "true" resolution. Just like the difference between "optical and digital" zoom on video recorders. Optical is the "true" zoom and digital is a larger image generated by the programming. Just be aware when you buy this "6" megapixel camera you are actually buying a 2 megapixel sensor.

Reviews.Title: Critters 'n Crooks
Reviews.Author: MrEd "Mr Ed"
Reviews.Content: Using it to discover what and when critters are trying to get my chickens,  and what  and when crooks are coming into my yard to "liberate"  gas stored for emergencies and for my boat.  Critters are the usual suspects - possums and raccoons - haven't photographed Snuffy Smif yet, but he doesn't live too far away.  Haven't photographed any crooks yet either,  but boating weather us not too far away.  Lost an outboard tank and stabil-ized 2 cycle mixed gas last year.Camera works great.  Good detail, and it switches from B&W; at night to color in daylight.  Settings are easy.  On second thought, wish I would have bought a larger SD; I bought an 8gb, class 4 but should've gotten a 32gb, class 10 for high resolution videos.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Charlie
Reviews.Content: Does everything it said it could and more . Very happy with the photos. Easy to setup. Would buy again.

Reviews.Title: Could be better
Reviews.Author: Nick
Reviews.Content: Compared to my Bushnell HD Trophy Cam this camera just didnt meet my expectations.  Its not bad for the price, but it doesnt function as well.  I had someone walk by the camera and wave at it, never took a picture of them.  Seems to only work under certain conditions.UPDATE: Oct 2013Camera has been taking some great photos.  I had played with some of the settings since my previous review.  Have many pictures of bucks and does.

Reviews.Title: Amazon is by far the best price!
Reviews.Author: Brad D
Reviews.Content: Great camera, easy to use, set up, and takes quality pics without breaking the bank. 4 stars due to a few pics just at dusk that could have been better, but if I had to purchase another this would be the one!

Reviews.Title: Bought two and both failed quickly
Reviews.Author: El_Guapo
Reviews.Content: I ordered my first Bushnell X-8 after reading reviews online. The first one didn't work when I got it. The sensor was messed up and it just randomly took pictures. I returned it and amazon sent me another. This one worked fine for two months then stopped working at all. When I turn it on it just makes a clicking sound. It sensed animals well but it also took grainy pictures. They were good enough to tell what they were but they were poor quality for a 6mp camera. I am very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: cyber
Reviews.Content: // To view this video download Flash Player (version 9.0.115 or higher)'); } } catch(err) { fp_resizePlayerSpace('cv_moZ6LJD16TZXEN', 0, 0); } return false; } function _cv_moZ6LJD16TZXENloadSwf(movieID, playerVersion) { var swfLocation = "http://g-ecx.images-amazon.com/images/G/01/am3/20120510035744301/AMPlayer._V148501545_.swf"; } var node = cv_moZ6LJD16TZXENpreplay.parentNode; var cv_moZ6LJD16TZXENcurrentClick = node.onclick; node.onclick = function () { var head = document.getElementsByTagName("head"); if (head[0]) { var logTag = document.createElement('script'); logTag.type = "text/javascript"; logTag.src = "/gp/customer-media/du/log.html?ie=UTF8&p=CustomerImage&s=CustomerVideoPlay"; head[0].appendChild(logTag); } if (cv_moZ6LJD16TZXENcurrentClick) { return cv_moZ6LJD16TZXENcurrentClick(); } } } Length:: 0:05 MinsI just got this trail cam. All the reviews do not do this camera justice. It is awesome!I set it up in 10 minutes. Tested it. Works great. The 6Mp photos are excellent in the daytime and the night photos are just great! For the $$$ it is worth every cent.I had this out for awhile. It performs fantastically. First night got a shrunk, second night a great photo of a coyote. No false triggers at the most sensitive PIR setting. Trigger set at medium. Summer weather.Check the product photos on Amazon for my photos! I added a video to my review!

Reviews.Title: LCD failed after two weeks
Reviews.Author: maddy379
Reviews.Content: Worked great out of the box.  I'm using it to monitor traffic on the little gravel road through my rural property.  If the vehicle is traveling slow enough I can zoom to capture license tag.  LCD failed after two weeks and I'm paying to ship it to Kansas (and back) for warranty repair.  I will update this rating when I get a reading on the Bushnell customer service.

Reviews.Title: Trail Cam
Reviews.Author: D. Hughes "2ocnorb"
Reviews.Content: This trail cam is pretty good. It takes decent pics both in the day and at night. It has a 1 sec trigger speed, but seems longer (2-3 seconds), since i've had several pictures of the rear ends of deer, having passed in front of the camera. Overall a good camera. Will definitely use it more next season.

Reviews.Title: awesome security camera
Reviews.Author: Che Mar
Reviews.Content: Don't forget to buy an SD card! This thing rocks. I got it because i live in the woods and have a driveway people mistake for a road. for security, i put this camera in a discrete location and it takes really great, high-resolution pictures. I empty the SD card once a month and keep a back up of images just in case. My neighbor had something stolen off her porch, and when she gave the date, i was able to pull license plate numbers for her! Best investment. Better than expected. the range and night vision capacity were also much better than expected.

Reviews.Title: Works great
Reviews.Author: citrus guy
Reviews.Content: Using it to see what is eating fruit off my plants.  Found out that I have rats, racoons, and possium eating my fruit.  Did not come with a memory chip and does not have a viewing screen.

Reviews.Title: I LOVE this camera!!
Reviews.Author: laur
Reviews.Content: The nighttime and daytime videos are excellent quality and I could not be happier. We set this up outside of the chicken coop and it captured a raccoon and her babies video. I also like that it records the time on the video. It will be interesting to see what else we catch on camera at night as we move this around the yard to see.

Reviews.Title: Trail cam
Reviews.Author: sixgun "RTKBA"
Reviews.Content: GREAT battery life!!! by that I mean 40 months on the same set of batteries.....I use this cam as a security cam around my property,,,,good trigger speed...good pic quality. YES without a doubt would by another!!

Reviews.Title: Good product
Reviews.Author: Realalien "The Grey"
Reviews.Content: I use this as a security camera and the pictures are good quality. The batteries last about 2 months on the photo mode. It's easy to set up and access the photos on the sd card. I would buy another one.

Reviews.Title: Trail Camera
Reviews.Author: S. Kennedy "Sandy"
Reviews.Content: great camera, easy to use, takes great pictures.recommened to friend, he purchased one as well, friend very pleased alsolong battery life

Reviews.Title: Works Great (For a few weeks)
Reviews.Author: Skepticon
Reviews.Content: I read another review before buying this piece of crap that said it worked for awhile, then stopped working. That is what happened. No weather related problems, no reason. just stopped. Unless you are ok to pay the price for a few weeks usage, then nothing. DON'T BUY THIS!!

Reviews.Title: My first Bushnell great..last two awful!
Reviews.Author: J. Morrison
Reviews.Content: We are avid bird watchers and have loved having a camera that not only catches the birds but our night visitors too.  The first Bushnell camera we purchased worked really well for almost two years..then quit.  This is my third camera and it will work OK for a few days and then quit.  We have not been able to solve the problem and our second camera had a similar problem.  I now think I am going to replace this camera with one of the new deer cams as I am not happy with the lack of reliability of these cameras.

Reviews.Title: Night vision camera
Reviews.Author: Sicily gal
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic camera!!! It is sooo good that you can see a wrinkle in a persons forehead, besides the animals you are watching!!! It is soo easy to set up and soo easy to review what pics have been taken.  So impressed that our son is purchasing a few for his new house ( it's near a stream, and has deer, fox, small animals) his family will get hours, and hours of enjoyment!!!

Reviews.Title: great little camera
Reviews.Author: Virgie Hall
Reviews.Content: I've been using this little camera for a while now and so far very happy with it.  It is easy to program also.

Reviews.Title: A good deal overall
Reviews.Author: serenityseeker
Reviews.Content: My first game camera so not an expert here. I bought two, one malfunctioned but the exchange was super easy and fast. The pictures are great most of the time. Only a cpl washed out at dawn, not sure why. Nigh time pics were to my satisfaction also. Haven't used the movie mode yet but overall very satisfied. Set up was pretty easy. Only had them out a few weeks so will update later.Update 10/30/13- Cameras have been great. Had an issue formatting the cards and customer service took great care of me. I don't use the video mode. Have many hundreds of pics now of all sorts of wildlife but mainly deer. High quality night and day pictures. Original batteries still lasting, no issues with weather etc. I would definitely recommend these game cameras. Ended up buying three.

Reviews.Title: broke
Reviews.Author: Teresa Jenkins
Reviews.Content: camera broke after 1 month of usage. I am very disappointed. I expected it to last longer. I want the unit replaced, I will not order from this company again.

Reviews.Title: good camera good picture
Reviews.Author: Benjamin Orendorff
Reviews.Content: works great for me, I ordered it used off amazon and it came with no instructions. Works great for me, I googled the instructions and all is well.Good luck and happy hunting

Reviews.Title: Good camera.
Reviews.Author: Gregory McKenney
Reviews.Content: I chose this camera based on the reputation of Bushnell.  This camera is easy to set up and to use, the picture quality is good, and its affordable.

Reviews.Title: Trail cam
Reviews.Author: Sarah O'Neil
Reviews.Content: My brother and I are having a great time with my new trail cam.  It works very well and holds up well even in rain.

Reviews.Title: Who's Afraid of the Dark
Reviews.Author: Skyler Kay
Reviews.Content: This is the best little surveillance camera for the money. Knew Bushnell made lenses and the very best binoculars, but didn't know they make these cameras. Bought one to see what wildlife was on my property, but it could just as easily be used on a porch or walk-way to monitor human activity/intruders. My only complaint is (1) that there is not a delete button, only an all or nothing option after viewing and (2)there was no view-finder. I soon discovered that the camera really doesn't need it a view-finder. We fenced a few acres of a new rural property in MA so that our six dogs could run free while we're outside, but when we let them out in the evenings they've been running up through the woods to a certain spot at the fence and barking...so we sat the camera on a rock, set it on video (which gives you 10 second clips at a time) and -- wow! -- the next morning we watched about 80 short clips of a red fox, a fisher, and later on a coyote! Just guessing, but I'd say the camera captures everything right in front of it to a distance and width of about 20ft. and the sensor is tripped up to 40'. Funny, but the only one who stared at and seemed very aware of the infra red camera light was the sly one -- the fox!

Reviews.Title: Great pictures
Reviews.Author: Jeff Guiler
Reviews.Content: Directions is not that intuitive, but now that it I figured out how to operate it, it is taking great pictures.

Reviews.Title: It does what it says it will do
Reviews.Author: J. Frey "Jim F"
Reviews.Content: This is a pretty good camera for its purpose. I have no experience with competitive products but it does what it says it will do. There a few features missing which would be useful. First some kind of view finder would be very helpful. Its hard to set this up strapped to a tree or other mounting approach and understand what is in the field of view. Second it would be useful if you could tell how many pictures had been triggered by the motion sensor without bring the camera or the card inside to a computer. But you get what you pay for here and I have enjoyed what it can do.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Mark
Reviews.Content: takes great pics every time,  very satisfied with this item , this is my second x-8 probably buy another one

Reviews.Title: Works well, reveals nighttime surprises
Reviews.Author: Jim
Reviews.Content: I wanted to see what was visiting our yard in the night. We're backed up to a green belt, and have deer, black bear, red fox and coyote. I was very pleasantly surprised to find out that we have a pair of grey foxes visiting, and I finally got a couple of very nice photos of a black bear (sow), standing about 5' 10" and must weigh 300 pounds.The only problem is that about every 10 photos produces an empty file, but with a 3-shot burst configured, this is not debilitating. I was also not expecting that it will not take videos at night - only during the day.Overall, I'm very satisfied with this camera for my needs.

Reviews.Title: An Excellent Wildlife Camera
Reviews.Author: David Cooper
Reviews.Content: This camera works as advertised.  It is easy to use. The pictures and images are very clear. Seems to be easy on the batteries too.

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: David R. Cass
Reviews.Content: does everything I wanted it to do and more I have a lot of animals roaming through my property at night

Reviews.Title: Great outdoor camera!
Reviews.Author: Jennifer L. Sibert
Reviews.Content: This camera met or exceeded all expectations.  It has been very useful for discovering wildlife visitors to our property, and it's very easy to set up and use.

Reviews.Title: Bushnell #1
Reviews.Author: Greg
Reviews.Content: Nice price! Good day pictures, OK night. Easy setup. My other Bushnells costs twice what this one did. Other brands just didn't perform or last as long as my BUSHNELL'S

Reviews.Title: Bushnell x8
Reviews.Author: cede
Reviews.Content: Works great. Batteries lasted so far for a month, thousands of pics, and still at 95%. I'm using energizer lithium.

Reviews.Title: Bushnell trail camera works when you want it to
Reviews.Author: howeey "Howeey"
Reviews.Content: Am highly pleased with the physical size of the camera. I am still testing in my yard to record deer, turkey's, coyottes, Racoons and Raptors that go by.My ultimate goal is to catch the politcal sign snatchers who stole  $250 worth of signs in one location in 2012.I will prosecute if I can get a good set of pictures.Also pleased with the quality of the pictures.

Reviews.Title: Worthwhile purchase
Reviews.Author: Curtiss A. Lukens
Reviews.Content: Excellent camera.  I have placed it out everynight in different locations and have captured photos of turtles to deer and one surprised poacher!  Who when confronted with the photo, confessed.  Easy to use with the features I need.

Reviews.Title: Works great
Reviews.Author: individualfromtexas
Reviews.Content: I bought another one for a different view. Love them both. Still on the first set of batteries and its taken more than 3000 pictures already. Definitely would recommend.

Reviews.Title: Picture in time.
Reviews.Author: Good Stuff
Reviews.Content: not a bad camera.  the motion doesn't work out to 50 feet at all - it's pretty much up to 10 feet and that's all i've experienced.  pics are great.  sucks up batteries on nightime imaging so be sure you know why you're taking nightime pics.  motion detection occurs anytime regardless, but that's not a problem.  have caught deer at 12:30am because of the motion detection.  no probs with the elements (rain, cold, etc.) as the pics have been consistent.  the time between burst picture taking is odd.  i set it for four seconds, but it could be one or it could be three or oh-my-gosh it could be four like i set it, but it's definitely not consistent.  trying with a larger delay of say 10 seconds to see if it's any better that way. so that means when i set the camera to take pics every two minutes, with the 3p setting i get three pics in sequence and i've now set the additional two pics to be taken 10 seconds after the first one and then 10 seconds after the second one - well that's how i understand it should work anyway.  being able to take time-lapse pics with this bursting is kind of cool and very helpful as opposed to taking a picture automatically every minute (the lowest setting).  it fills up a 16GB card in two weeks if not taking night time pics (picture every minute during the day basically) - no picture burst.  if picture bursting (3p) then it fills up fast and i'd recommend getting the max card size, which i think is 32GB. i would get this camera again for my purposes, but if i wanted better sequencing (picture bursting time delay) or motion detection i'd find something more reliable.

Reviews.Title: I am not impressed
Reviews.Author: Danny Clark
Reviews.Content: I have set this trail camera up and used every combination possible. I have captured 3 short videos. 1 video the coyote came in to eat the bait but the infrared glow scared it off. The placement of where he appeared in the in the video it was obvious he had walked into the cameras field of vision about 10 feet before it registered a life form. I have had nights where all the bait has disappeared and I don't have a photo or video to show for it. I have bought a Bone Collector Trail Camera (it's in the mail) on a recommendation of a friend who has had very good results and big differences in test runs with his other cameras on the same tree and covering the exact area. The X-8 did catch a couple of open shots with nothing in them, I am guessing the trees about 35 feet away moved just enough in the wind to trigger the photo. The web belt for attaching the device to a tree has some issues as well, such as it will not tighten very tight to keep camera in place. The only reason I gave it a 2 rating is because I did get those 3 videos over a weeks worth of trial and error. I was wondering if the lack of photo captures are because smaller animals are coming in such as Raccoons or Cats. I will have to test it on my cats someday when I have more time Make sure you set this up very close to home for the learning curve or you will be VERY DISPPOINTED. BTW I did buy the 32 GB Class 10 Mini SanDisk on some recommendations of users posting their reviews about this product, I am not so sure a person has to go to that extreme from what I saw in the Videos. Good Luck

Reviews.Title: Dissatisfied
Reviews.Author: Dolores Avram
Reviews.Content: No matter what I did I could not get it to take pictures at night.  It would detect the critter eating my plants, snap a picture and then have a totally black picture.  Very unhappy with this product.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: J
Reviews.Content: It does exactly what you want when you want it to. No problems at all. I would recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: decent camera
Reviews.Author: Bunny
Reviews.Content: The price was right and these camera's seem to take good quality pictures and the batteries last a long time.

Reviews.Title: Bushnell Trail Camera
Reviews.Author: Bretney
Reviews.Content: I ordered this for my boyfriend for the hunting season. He hasn't actually gotten to use it just yet but he has tried it out and he likes it a lot.

Reviews.Title: Bushnell x-8 6mp review
Reviews.Author: gran
Reviews.Content: Im very satisfied with this camera good price great pictures color is detailed an sun reflection is barley noticeable....very happy with this purchase

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera
Reviews.Author: Brian Tucker
Reviews.Content: I love this camera.  Best battery life of all my cameras, good trigger speed.  I have 3 of them now.

Reviews.Title: just what I need.
Reviews.Author: Cimacol "sace"
Reviews.Content: just what I need, excelent resolution at day, at night would be better longer distance performance. GOOD IR SENSITIVY AND LASTING BATTERY.

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: Mike Roland
Reviews.Content: A little more difficult to program than my other bushnell cameras but all in all a good camera pics are good both day and night.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Value
Reviews.Author: Alvarez
Reviews.Content: This camera is inexpensive, yet delivers great day and night pictures. We've seen foxes, bobcats, frequenting our pond that we had either not seen before or rarely seen, as well as the normal night animals. Set up is a cinch.

Reviews.Title: Greatttttt
Reviews.Author: daniel smith
Reviews.Content: Excellent Camera best on the market in my opinion. This camera has long battery life and takes excellent pictures. You will not be disappointed

Reviews.Title: Good cam
Reviews.Author: beth
Reviews.Content: The night vision on this camera is a neat feature. Usually, the night vision cams are very pricey but not this one.

Reviews.Title: Bushnell x-8 6 mp trail camera
Reviews.Author: im lounsberry
Reviews.Content: Good camera, with good day and night pictures. Would recomend this camera in this price range for the average hunter

Reviews.Title: great camera good price
Reviews.Author: william r.barron
Reviews.Content: camera works great, after  I found out how to take it off time lapse.  takes great pics, and is nice and light, easy to set up, great battery life, would buy another...

Reviews.Title: Trail camera
Reviews.Author: Amy Kushinski
Reviews.Content: Still too early to write a great review, but it seems like a good camera.  It's a little hard to use, but we are trying different settings to get the pictures we want.

Reviews.Title: Pure Fun!
Reviews.Author: Deborah S "djs"
Reviews.Content: Having fun with this camera.  See the wildlife that visits while asleep.  Good pics, easy to use.  Lots of fun!

Reviews.Title: Waste of money
Reviews.Author: chris
Reviews.Content: Worked good for about 6 weeks then stopped working. At 125.00 not worth it at all. Also took a lot of pictures of nothing.

Reviews.Title: Great Gift
Reviews.Author: Joan Quatro "Booker Hooker"
Reviews.Content: Great gift for an outdoorsman relative.He seems very  pleased with it.He likes the features, size and capability of being able to add a Steel protective cover if need be.

Reviews.Title: Very happy with it.
Reviews.Author: information paradox
Reviews.Content: In comparison to my old Cuddeback, it is a lot smaller and easier to hide.Image quality is a little better than the old Cudde.It is MUCH easier to setup.Power switch makes changing cards easier (the Cudde was turned on and off by installing or removing the batteries).2 options for battery usage is a nice touch. You can fill it up with all it can hold, giving you more run time, or fill it with half.Trigger speed is good but not great. Place it accordingly.IR feature works without a hitch, but it would be nice if you could turn off the visible red LED blink when it takes a picture.Doesn't like SD cards formatted by other devices (didn't jive with one formatted by my Nikon). I would keep a few specifically formatted by the X-8.

Reviews.Title: My First trail cam
Reviews.Author: eli kim
Reviews.Content: This is my first trail cam.  I first used it in my room to see if people were creeping in my room when im not home.  IT did a great job.The quality of the pictures are ok and can't complain.  I also had money stolen out of my car in my own driveway so i want to see what hoodlums are doing it... once i see the results of shooting pictures at a further distance i will update.

Reviews.Title: Very pleased
Reviews.Author: John Puccetti
Reviews.Content: The price was great. It was delivered on time. It is doing what I wanted it to do. I am using it as a security camera for our driveway. Our cars have been egged six times. It is vandalism eggs can cause permanent damage. Instructions are not clear.

Reviews.Title: Nice Game/Security Camera
Reviews.Author: James F. Alkek "Jim Alkek"
Reviews.Content: Easy to use instructions, easy to set up, easy to change settings and retrieve pictures/video. Pictures are very clear and in focus.

Reviews.Title: Good camera, takes dark, but visible night picks
Reviews.Author: Habo
Reviews.Content: This is my first trailcam.  Though many of my night picks are black hogs and a black bear, the pictures seem a bit dark.  The day pics are terrific.  I tried a few different settings until got the best combo.  I have not used video mode.  4 months later a few thousand pics and I am still on the original batteries.  I have noticed that while in 3 pic burst, there were a few missed pics ( me walking by, only 1 pic taken).  Overall I am happy and love using a trail cam.

Reviews.Title: Works for us
Reviews.Author: B. MOONEY "Red Cliffs"
Reviews.Content: In just a few days of use, this has identified the critters that have eaten our raspberries down to the ground, e.g., several pack rats who have evaded the live traps we set out.  Now my husband has to figure out a trap they can't avoid.  This camera will also be useful in other parts of our garden and in our mini-orchard, and to just watch what critters wander our land at night.  It is simple to set up (we used a tripod), and so far a 1gb SD card is plenty of storage for our needs.

Reviews.Title: Love this trail camera.
Reviews.Author: KIBILL
Reviews.Content: Amazes me how many animals I have in my backyard at night.  So far I have captured pictures of deer, coyotes, bobcat, and a bunch of rabbits. The pictures are very clear and you can make out every detail of the animals.

Reviews.Title: This is a great camera
Reviews.Author: Dead_catz
Reviews.Content: After purchasing this and the more expensive HD trophy cam by bushnell I like the other one ALOT better, the setup is very simple on this camera the easiest i ahve ever used but the motion detection is terrible by comparison, it has to be pointed perfectly at the area you want to photograph and it has to be very close, i would definately buy another Bushnell HD trophy cam but wouldnt touch this one again for the poor PIR

Reviews.Title: Long Battery life!
Reviews.Author: josh
Reviews.Content: The batteries last  a lot longer in the camera versus my m-80 camera! Takes good pics and is easy to operate.

Reviews.Title: Backyard pond surveillance.
Reviews.Author: coinr
Reviews.Content: I'm very pleased with this camera and don't think I could come up with any improvements to it.  It gives such a wide range of settings that everyone should be able to adjust it to suit their needs.  I use it to see what animals are coming to my backyard koi pond.  You would be surprised to see what shows up even living in the city.  The batteries last months even with taking hundreds of photos a day.  I've used the strap it came with to hook it up to a tree, a fence and a chair.  The pictures are a nice quality.  It's relatively easy to set up.  I'm using an 8 gb card but would recommend a larger one if you will be going extended periods without downloading the pictures.

Reviews.Title: Trail camera
Reviews.Author: Kevin L. Gregory
Reviews.Content: These devices are awesome great night photos. I will be recommending them to others seeking similar night camera devices as we were

Reviews.Title: Husband's Christmas present
Reviews.Author: gpad
Reviews.Content: I gave this to my husband for Christmas so that he could see how his food plots were doing for his hunting.  He really likes it.  Very easy to set up and then review on computer and picture quality is great.

Reviews.Title: I love it
Reviews.Author: lare
Reviews.Content: very nice

Reviews.Title: Great!!
Reviews.Author: martha
Reviews.Content: Just what it was supposed to be! This is a great trail cam, bought it for our son.  We already had one like it and it works really great!

Reviews.Title: I like it.
Reviews.Author: Pam Winter
Reviews.Content: I like it and when I learn how to use it, I'm  sure I will like it even more.  It seems to do everything it is advertised to do.  I had some trouble getting the right height.  And some troubles getting batteries right.  It likes fresh new batteries I found.  Once I got the settings correct, it seems to work very well.

Reviews.Title: best cameral
Reviews.Author: Paul m Clarke
Reviews.Content: great camera,  Camera works fine  well made no complaints easy to install with stand sold separate or make your own

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera…..
Reviews.Author: Janice Etue
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent camera, especially for the price.  Very user friendly and extremely reliable.  The photo are very, very good.  I would highly recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Pretty good
Reviews.Author: The Wretched Reviewer With Malice Aforethough...
Reviews.Content: Got some good B&W; photos of our local grey fox and a coyote in the middle of the night.  I always have wondered what's wandering through in the A.M. hours.  My only complaint for this unit would be the snap-hooks that you close it up with.  One or the other is always in the wrong position as you close it up, not a big deal though.

Reviews.Title: good quality camera
Reviews.Author: Donald Ridenour
Reviews.Content: This is a good quality trail cam at a good buy, has not failed me yet. I chose this Cam because Bushnell service is excellent in the future I will buy all trail cams and optics from Bushnell because of their customer service.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera
Reviews.Author: KEVIN
Reviews.Content: Our old camera had a 15 second burst so we only got pictures of deer and turkeys.  This one is so much better.  Now we get pictures of foxes, squirrels and just got a mountain lion (posted in the picture section).  Excellent quality shots as well.

Reviews.Title: Bushnell X-8 Trail Camera
Reviews.Author: Alan McIver
Reviews.Content: Does everything I expected of it.Programmed it on the first try, with no confidence it was done correctly. But the booklet seems to explain it two different places, in two different ways.

Reviews.Title: Bushnell X-8 6MP Trail Camera with Night Vision and Field Scan
Reviews.Author: oshirenshi
Reviews.Content: Bushnell X-8 6MP Trail Camera with Night Vision and Field Scan ;  great product.  rang is a little better in the daylight then stated.  I am satisfied withthe lowest quality settings for pictures.  play with them an find out what works best for you

Reviews.Title: What fun to see "what is out there"
Reviews.Author: Nashville Nancy
Reviews.Content: Deer are out there.  Lots of deer.  And coyotes, and crows.  A fox and possums.  I found this easy to program and easy to use.  I did get a lot (over 1000) pics.  The birds seem to set it off.  I've adjusted the settings, but it is really easy to delete the photos I don't want.  I used an SD card with lots of memory, so no problem.  Have fun!

Reviews.Title: works as expected
Reviews.Author: E. Schwartz "nvcmtbkr"
Reviews.Content: Using to determine what is digging holes in front of my door.  Caught a rat on camera.  Did the job.

Reviews.Title: very nice
Reviews.Author: Redneck Soccer Mom
Reviews.Content: Takes good pictures and is easy to use. It's so fun to see what's just wondering around that you would miss otherwise, can't wait to get some more.

Reviews.Title: Good product
Reviews.Author: thoang8
Reviews.Content: Good product. Good quality. It takes extremely good pictures and ok night vision. Wish the range was better but overall good for the price.

Reviews.Title: Have used it only at night for 9 nights and got a few pics but today it won't work.
Reviews.Author: Patricia A Ridge
Reviews.Content: I used 8 alkaline batteries so I don't think that's the problem. When I turn it on, it says "Wait" on steady and it won't go off. I've removed the batteries and put back in and removed sd card and put back in. Nothing helps. I was so excited to receive this camera but am so disappointed that now it won't work. Guess I'd better return it.

Reviews.Title: Trail Camera Bushnell X-8
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth Burns
Reviews.Content: Don't know much about cameras but have had a good time so far watching our wildlife.  The set up was easy for this basic camera.  It did come with a tree hook and a belt strap, had to furnish the batteries and the memory card myself.  Right now it's kept on a tripod until we figure out the best placement for it.  The camera appears to be well made and feel it was a good buy.

Reviews.Title: so far, GOOD.
Reviews.Author: cj
Reviews.Content: Takes decent photos at the limits of its sensor range day and night. Maybe a little further.Used during rain, snow and low temperatures with good results.I'm using 4 premium AA batteries for two weeks and the battery indicator shows full charge.I like the compact size.

Reviews.Title: Great Christmas gift
Reviews.Author: Meta Miller
Reviews.Content: This camera was a Christmas gift to our son. He has seen deer, fox and even a coyote what is next a bear?

Reviews.Title: Just as Advertised
Reviews.Author: Linda Saltus
Reviews.Content: This camera has the features it brags about, and the instruction booklet makes sense. The proof will be how it functions in the field in the fall of 2013.

Reviews.Title: very disappointed
Reviews.Author: oscar
Reviews.Content: Just received camera. Purchased new batterys.installed per instruction., set to on pushed setup. Menu. Would not come up only a message. Flashing "wait. NOSD. Guess I will box it up and send back. Ok so I slept and tried inserting an sd card now I can set up the menu. This may be a camera I like, but whoever wrote the manual saying sd card is optional must be smoking dope. Mine will not set up without it

Reviews.Title: The resolution is a lie but other than that it's a nice product
Reviews.Author: landen "landen"
Reviews.Content: This camera lies about its resolution. If you have it set to the highest resolution it just enlarges the picture after taking it at a lower resolution. Which is bad enough but the delay caused by the time it takes to upscale the picture has caused people problems with the motion sensor. So there is no point in using anything other than the lowest resolution setting and then just zooming in, in the software on the computer when you view the pictures.It does have long battery life and nice features

Reviews.Title: Small, Good price
Reviews.Author: Richmond Kid
Reviews.Content: The first night produced good photos, but I don't know how this will do long-term.  I have no reason to think it won't be good.  Pretty easy to set up and mount.  Good photo quality for the price.

Reviews.Title: Very easy to set up and use
Reviews.Author: Edward C Propes
Reviews.Content: From the time I opened the package it took me less than 30 minutes to have it ready. Using it on the trails has been easy and I've captured 4 animals in the first week of use. In late winter there are still not that many animals moving so I am happy with that. I have a 32 Meg card in it and have taken over 900 pics in one night.

Reviews.Title: Got my first pictures.
Reviews.Author: Danielbo
Reviews.Content: Just moved to the country and this was the first thing I wanted. We sat it out and wasnt getting nothing, was concern it wasnt working or the dogs was scaring them off. We noticed on the other side of the house where there was prints in the snow. We move the salt block, and corn feeder over to the other side. First we saw one deer, then two, now we are up to 4 and something else. I love it now that I am getting pictures. So cool. I think I am going to stick a WIFI camera out there to watch them too. It is so much fun, we get all excited to see what happen the night before. Its full of extras too. Love it. People at work say they have three or more of them, thought one would be enough but see another one on order soon.

Reviews.Title: I saw the deer but it didn't!
Reviews.Author: Bruce B Bonner
Reviews.Content: The product is oversold as to the depth of field it "sees".  I could not place it close to the feeding spot and avoid the sunrise glare. Thus it is installed about 20 feet away.  The only "big animal" it picked up was ME shoveling snow and putting out food.  Yesterday I saw four deer but it failed to record them. I will put up a mounting post closer to the site when the spring arrives! That should help.

Reviews.Title: BEWARE Its NOT 8 MP
Reviews.Author: Christine
Reviews.Content: Beware this is a 6 MP camera, not 8MP. Pictures are fuzzy but for night shots it serves its purpose. The description is just misleading.

Reviews.Title: Works Fine, but batteries don't last as long as they say
Reviews.Author: J. Noe
Reviews.Content: other than that it's a good little camera...could use a wider field of view...color in daytime, b/w at night.  Mine is set to record video...just adding words here to meet the minimum required to submit.

Reviews.Title: TO EASY TO TAKE!!!!
Reviews.Author: Kimberli Halliday
Reviews.Content: It was stolen the first time we put it up! Needs to be harder to steel or cut off a tree.

ProductInfo.Features:
4 or 6MP high-quality full color resolution.
Day/night autosensor.
External power compatible.
Adjustable PIR (Lo/Med/High).
1-second trigger speed.
Programmable trigger interval: 1 second to 10 minutes..
Multi-image mode: 1 or 3 images per trigger.
Video length: 5 to 15 seconds, programmable.
Field Scan time-lapse mode takes images at pre-set intervals, 1-60 minutes.
Temperature range -5° F to 140° F.
PIR sensor is motion activated out to 45'.
Runs up to 9 months on one set of batteries.
Adjustable web belt and 1/4-20 socket.
SD card slot compatible with up to a 32GB SD card
ProductInfo.Name: Bushnell X-8 6MP Trail Camera with Night Vision and Field Scan
